reviewText: This workout is an advanced (if you go heavy) pure body sculpting workout using compound exercises, no cardio in-between, like so many FIRM workouts. But because of the leg work, it gets your heart rate up and you work up a good sweat. The pace is perfect allowing you to use heavy weights, yet no resting. Nancy gets a lot done in just 30 minutes. If the accent bothered me in the beginning, I didn't notice it later, I was too busy working out and liking it.  This is a great workout!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a good video for those who are pressed for time because you get to work both your upper and lower body at the same time, rather than having to do separate videos or routines. The leg work is quite challenging and you are definitely sweating by the end of this tape. However, I gave this video four stars because there is very little ab work; just a few more minutes of ab work would have made it a complete toning routine. Also, I used a step rather than the required "Fanny Lifter," which made some of the moves a little awkward.Another brief note--Nancy Tucker has a distinct Southern accent which might be a little difficult for people in other parts of the country to get used to. But of course being from Alabama it didn't bother me much!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have alot of Firm workouts from different time periods and I don't think this one is very good. I think they were trying to make this a work where you use multiple muscle groups at the same time and I don't think it worked too well. If you want to sculpt your body and you have the time try the Firm's " Super Sculpting " workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: To my knowledge, this is the shortest Firm weight workout at 35 minutes.  The workout may be brief, but the intensity is fairly high and I worked up a good sweat.  The speed is fairly slow paced, but the transitions between the use of the fanny lifter and weights are very quick, so you're moving constantly.There is one section I despised immediately in a good way.  While using the fanny lifter, you alternate full leg presses with "fast, pulsing" leg presses.  By the end of that set on each leg, I had serious muscle fatigue and could hardly get up on to the fanny lifter on the full leg presses.The routine was fairly easy to follow and wasn't plagued by the complicated footwork of the cardio workouts of this era.  The instructor, Nancy Tucker, was pleasant and did a good job.  There was one section in which she didn't tell you how many of each of a few alternating moves to make, which got a little confusing, but was not a big deal.Overall, I felt as if I got a fairly intense and good workout for upper and lower body in a short period of time.  While brief, it wasn't frenzied but got a lot in a little bit of time.  As others have mentioned, the one area of the body neglected is the abs, although there is one very brief section for the obliques.  That would be easy to remedy by either buying 5 Day Abs or More 5 Day Abs and selecting one of those 10 workouts to combine with this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Nancy Tucker leads this 30 minute routine, she is joined by 4 fellow Firm Master Instructors including Libby who shows beginner modifications.  Assorted dumbells are used plus the Fanny Lifter, though any step or stool will work.This workout consists of a lot of compound movements, where you are working your upper and lower body at the same time, some examples include squats and overhead presses, plie squats and bicep curls, leg presses and bicep curls, lunges and bicep curls,  etc.  Though there are plenty of exercises done on their own, such as one arm lat rows, pushups, double arm lat rows, leg presses with tempo variations, side lateral raises, etc.  I found that I had to use lighter weights than normal for most of this workout, due to the compound movements plus a few of the exercises are performed at a quicker pace, such as the leg presses with tempo variations.  As another reviewer stated, there isn't much ab work in this workout, just a couple sets of seated oblique work.I enjoyed this workout, while I personally recommend and use lighter weights for this routine, I wouldn't call it easy.  A solid effort by the Firm, and my favorite from the BSS1 series.  This is also my favorite Firm led by Nancy, 4 and a half stars for this one.
summary: Packs quite a punch in 30 minutes...
Title: N/A
